
// create blog site
mkdir blog
cd blog

Start a new Git repository for an existing code base
$ cd /path/to/my/codebase
$ git init      (1)
$ git add .     (2)
$ git commit    (3)

git commit -m 'init'

1)Create a /path/to/my/codebase/.git directory.

2)Add all existing files to the index.

3)Record the pristine state as the first commit in the history.
touch index.html

git status

//starting Jekyll
rm - rf blog

Roberts-MacBook-Pro:~ robertsabec$ jekyll
-bash: jekyll: command not found
//https://jekyllrb.com/docs/installation/macos/
sudo gem install bundler
sudo gem install -n /usr/local/bin/ jekyll

Dependency	Version
jekyll	3.8.5
If you installed Bundler:
To create a new Jekyll site, use the jekyll new command, replacing VERSION with the current dependency version for Jekyll.
For more information, see "Dependency versions" on the GitHub Pages site.

$ bundle exec jekyll VERSION new .
# Creates a Jekyll site in the current directory
